FuncDef:
The multicast ipv6 load-splitting command configures an IPv6 multicast load splitting policy.
The undo multicast ipv6 load-splitting command restores the default configuration. The multicast ipv6 load-splitting command configures an IPv6 multicast load splitting policy. The undo multicast ipv6 load-splitting command restores the default configuration. By default, no IPv6 multicast load splitting policy is configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: multicast ipv6 load-splitting { group | source | source-group | stable-preferred | balance-ucmp }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates group address-based load splitting. This policy applies to the scenario where one multicast source has multiple multicast groups.
-

Indicates source address-based load splitting. This policy applies to the scenario where one multicast group has multiple multicast sources.
-

Indicates source and group addresses-based load splitting. This policy is applicable to the scenario where multiple multicast sources and multicast groups exist.
-

Indicates stable-preferred load splitting, which is applicable to a stable multicast networking.
-

Indicates link bandwidth-based load splitting. This policy is applicable to the scenario in which links have different bandwidth.
-
